dialogue.text: I decide to go to the local DVD store, but quickly discover that it is anything but that and I feel very let down.
However, as an adamant supporter of small businesses, I decide to peruse the selection anyway.
Welcome in. Please take your-
Ah?!
A [young_girl] at the front desk calls out to me, but abruptly stops for some reason.
I take a quick look around the store to see if maybe she's reacting to someone else but quickly confirm that it must have been something {i}I{/i} did.
What, though? I've only been inside for like, five seconds.
We...are closed!
But the sign outside said you were open for another two hours.
That sign is old! Please leave now!
I make my way over to the counter as I'm tired of shouting across the room and the girl immediately shields her face.
She looks to be the age of one of my students, so I don't hold it against her for getting embarrassed about working in a place like this-
But she should at least be {i}somewhat{/i} helpful to customers, shouldn't she?
Or...maybe this is another one of those {i}no males around{/i} type of deals that I heard Ami talk about?
If this girl doesn't have any experience helping male customers...
Well, honestly, that just makes me want her help even more.
What...uh...
What can I...do for you?...
Wait a minute...
Of course...take as long as you-
Aah!
Un...Unhand me right now! I'll call the cops! I mean it!
...Makoto?
Nope! No Makoto's here! You must be confusing me for someone else!
You look completely different without your glasses on.
Never mind my glasses! What the Hell are you doing in here, Sensei?!
You know what kind of store this is, don't you?
I'm actually just stopping by to give you your homework. I looked up your address in the school registry.
Wait...really? But I could have sworn-
Yes. Here you go.
I hand Makoto her homework.
Thank you. That was very kind.
I was unaware that you worked in this establishment, Makoto.
I am so embarrassed that you are now aware of my workplace.
Listen, I get that it's probably embarrassing to be seen somewhere like this by your teacher...but I'm not going to hold it against you.
This is your family's business, right? I think it’s admirable that you're helping out here.
Now, can you please point me toward the teen section?
That's it. I am going to kill myself tonight.
Oh come on. Isn’t it better to be dealing with me than some random guy?
I mean...I'd prefer to not be dealing with either...
For what it's worth, it wouldn't make any difference to me if you worked here or some fast food restaurant. A job is a job and you just happened to wind up with this one.
Well...thank you, Sensei. That's-
In fact, I implore {i}more{/i} girls your age to work in places like this. Because not only would it bring more customers in, it would help-
Okay, you know what? Just...pick something and get out. It's clear that arguing about this is going to somehow negatively affect our relationship, and I would very much prefer to not do that.
Great. So what do you recommend?
Huh?
Me?
Yeah. What’s the big ticket item here? What should I buy?
You’re...asking me for recommendations?
Yeah. You're the porn expert, aren't you?
My mom is the expert...I just kinda...you know...
Ahh. So you're just a porn {i}hobbyist.{/i}
No...I am a normal girl.
Normal girls watch porn and you shouldn't be ashamed to admit that you do too.
I watch all kinds of stuff. They used to call me the {i}stuff watcher{/i} back in college in between all of those times where they'd shove me into lockers.
Can you at least tell me...some of the stuff you're interested in so I can make a recommendation?
Mainly board games and long walks on the beach.
Oh! Do you have the Wedding Singer on DVD? I would very much like to watch that with my accountant later.
Yeah, I tried...but I really can't do this.
I think it might be better if you just use the Internet after all...
How about you just follow me around the store and I point out all of the stuff I'm interested in?
That sounds like it would work, right?
Oh, and maybe after that, you could show me all of the stuff {i}you're{/i} interested in and-
Oh, look at the time! We’re closed!
No you're not. It's only been like ten minutes since I walked in and-
Thanks for stopping in, Sensei! It was nice seeing you!
Please never come back and forget where I work now!
Makoto begins pushing me to the door, but I refuse to leave this place without something to watch tonight.
In a desperate attempt to avoid leaving empty-handed, I reach out and grab the first DVD I see on the way out of the shop.
Hey! You can't just-
Ugh, never mind! Just take it! I’ll pay for it myself!
I give up resisting once I have something in my hands and Makoto is eventually able to push me outside, quickly locking the door behind me.
Goodnight, Sensei! You were never here and neither was I!
Goodnight, Makoto. See you tomorrow night.
I sure hope not!
Left alone with nothing but my new DVD and the night sky, I glance down to inspect the cover.
“Napoleon Dynamite?” Ugh!
I turn around, determined to return the DVD as I refuse to watch this pathetic drivel, but Makoto does not let me back in =/
{i}Makoto’s affection has increased to [makoto_love]!{/i}
